headline: Exclusive: Is Apple Late To Foldable iPhones? Ming-Chi Kuo Says Cupertino Isn't At 'Disadvantage' As Samsung Sees Foldables Go Mainstream
summary: Apple Inc.'s (NASDAQ:AAPL) long-anticipated entry into the foldable iPhone market may not be as delayed — or as risky — as it appears, according to analyst Ming-Chi Kuo, even as Samsung Electronics Co. (OTC:SSNLF) says the category is nearing mainstream adoption. Apple's Timing May Not Be A Problem After All Apple has yet to launch a foldable iPhone, but Kuo, a TF International Securities analyst known for tracking Apple's supply chain, told Benzinga that timing alone does not put Cupertino at a

headline: Netflix Reportedly Prepares All-Cash Bid For Warner Bros. As Paramount Turns Up Heat On Takeover Battle
summary: Netflix Inc. (NASDAQ:NFLX) is reportedly preparing to revise the terms of its $82.7 billion deal to buy Warner Bros. Discovery (NASDAQ:WBD) to make it an all-cash offer, as it seeks to fend off Paramount Skydance’s (NASDAQ:PSKY) hostile bid. The revised deal, aimed at offering WBD shareholders a quicker and simpler transaction, is still under negotiation and may change, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter. Netflix and WBD did not immediately respond to

headline: Meta Triples Down on AI. It Could Be a Wild Ride for the Stock.
summary: Meta Platforms  CEO Mark Zuckerberg has never shied away from big moves, from dropping out of Harvard University to work on a fledgling social-media company to changing the name of that company even after it crossed $100 billion in annual sales.  This week, he may have signaled his largest move yet—a massive multiyear program, probably in excess of a trillion dollars, to build a global network of artificial-intelligence data centers.  A trillion dollars is a lot of money, even more than  Meta’s  Facebook and Instagram can provide, so the company also hired a banker as its new president and vice chairman.

content.title: Meta Triples Down on AI. It Could Be a Wild Ride for the Stock.

This week, he may have signaled his largest move yet—a massive multiyear program, probably in excess of a trillion dollars, to build a global network of artificial-intelligence data centers.  A trillion dollars is a lot of money, even more than  Meta’s  Facebook and Instagram can provide, so the company also hired a banker as its new president and vice chairman.

headline: This Unstoppable Stock Has Soared 1,550% Since Its IPO. It Could Be the Most Prominent Stock-Split Stock of 2026.
summary: This industry leader is riding secular tailwinds that are expected to fuel its growth for years to come.
